remarks: A version of ~ dral1 with a context.  Note:  At first glance one might be tempted to generalize this (or a similar) theorem by weakening the first two hypotheses adding a ` x = y ` , ` A. x x = y ` or ` ph ` antecedent. ~ wl-equsal1i and ~ nfdi show that this is in fact pointless.  (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 28-Jul-2019.)
statement:
wl-dral1d.1 $e |- F/ x ph $.
wl-dral1d.2 $e |- F/ y ph $.
wl-dral1d.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( x = y -> ( ps <-> ch ) ) ) $.
wl-dral1d $p |- ( ph -> ( A. x x = y -> ( A. x ps <-> A. y ch ) ) ) $.
